<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/19/apple-surpasses-2-trillion-valuation-widens-lead-biggest-company-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple’s Stock Must Be Using One of Those Big Charging Blocks
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Gold Apple" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTU1L2dvbGRfYXBwbGUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple’s market cap <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/19/apple-reaches-2-trillion-market-cap.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surpassed $2 trillion</a> for the first time yesterday, cementing its status as the biggest company in the world. Its stock, which will undergo a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/30/apple-stock-split-announced.html#:~:text=Apple%20announces%204%2Dfor%2D1%20stock%20split&text=Closing%20Bell-,Apple%20on%20Thursday%20announced%20in%20its%20fiscal%20third%2Dquarter%20earnings,ll%20receive%20three%20additional%20shares.?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">4-1 split</a> in the coming weeks, has increased over 50% in 2020. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple wasn’t the first to break the $2 trillion valuation mark—that honor goes to the oil conglomerate Saudi Aramco—and it (probably) won’t be the last. Big Tech buddies Amazon and Microsoft are both sitting at valuations <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/19/tech/apple-stock-two-trillion-market-value/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">around $1.6 trillion</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">A crazy stat: </strong></span><span>it took Apple 42 years to reach a $1 trillion valuation, but only two years after that to break $2 trillion.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How’d Apple do it?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pretty much by just being Apple. The iPhone maker hasn’t released an entirely new product since the HomePod in 2018, mostly focusing on tweaking or updating existing lines. But if there is one thing Apple does well, it’s make money: Despite the pandemic, Apple’s Q3 profits rose 12% while sales of <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/19/technology/apple-2-trillion.html?partner=IFTTT&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">every single product</a> increased. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But it doesn’t just sell iPhones: </strong>Part of investors’ Apple fever has been fueled by CEO Tim Cook’s increased focus on its services business that includes Apple Music, Apple TV+, iCloud, and the App Store. In 2017, Cook outlined his goal to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/19/apples-2-trillion-value-proof-that-tim-cooks-services-plan-worked.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">double 2016 services revenue</a> by 2020, which he achieved six months ahead of schedule. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It was a prescient move. With iPhone sales plateauing worldwide, Cook’s pivot has investors valuing Apple less like a hardware company and more like a software one.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">There will always be controversy</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After Cook testified in the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/21/monopoly-aint-just-board-game-brew-explains-antitrust?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">antitrust showdown</a> with Congress last month, <em>Fortnite </em>creator Epic Games poked the bear by attempting to circumvent Apple’s 30% cut of in-app purchases. But even as other developers have <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/14/apps-including-facebook-rally-apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">joined in</a> to criticize Apple’s alleged monopolistic control of the app marketplace, investors remain unfazed. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Apple optimism continues to abound. The iPhone 12 coming this fall is widely expected to come equipped with <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/guides/5g-in-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">5G connectivity</a>.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
Airbnb's Doing the IPO Thing
</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="SUN VALLEY, ID - JULY 08:  Brian Chesky, co-founder and CEO of Airbnb, a..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTU5L2J1c2luZXNzX2xlYWRlcnNfY29udmVyZ2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Scott Olson/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A collapsed travel industry, 25% of its workforce laid off...Airbnb swept it all aside like it’s preparing for an 11am checkout.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the short-term home rental company filed <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/19/airbnb-has-filed-confidential-ipo-paperwork.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">confidential paperwork</a> to go public, a big step that’s been rumored for years.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Things were looking hairy as the coronavirus decimated the travel industry in March/April. However, the company rebounded thanks to increased demand for rural rental properties.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s still a shell of its former self. Airbnb was last valued at $18 billion when it raised money this spring—only about half its valuation in 2017. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You buying?</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/19/study-ceo-pay-increased-14-average-2018-2019?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Additional Maserati Parking Space Needed in Southampton
</font></a>
</h1>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Simpsons GIF of rich students " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=503 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3orieWbs0HN2mssu1G/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Simpsons GIF of rich students " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3orieWbs0HN2mssu1G/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The CEOs of America's largest companies got a major pay bump (14% on average) from 2018–2019, according to a <a href="https://files.epi.org/pdf/204513.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new study</a> from the Economic Policy Institute, a left-leaning think tank. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Why? The study’s authors say the increase in realized compensation stems from 1) the power CEOs have to set their own pay and 2) stock-based compensation accounting for a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/19/study-average-ceo-pay-increased-in-2019-to-21point3-million-dollars.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">major slice</a> of CEO income. That means execs make more $$$ when their company's stock price jumps, rather than hitting other benchmarks.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The authors expect CEO pay to leap again in 2020 for that reason—they're paid in stock, and the S&P just reached an all-time high. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>“Exorbitant CEO pay is a major contributor to rising inequality that we could safely do away with,” the authors argue. To take the long view, CEO pay increased 1,167% from 1978 to 2019, but the typical worker's pay grew a measly 13.7% over the same time span, according to the study's calculations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it hits different in the COVID era: </strong>Some economists are forecasting a “K-shaped” recovery, where those at the top get richer and those at the bottom fall even further behind.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/19/facebook-cracks-qanon-harmful-groups-platform?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Move Fast and Break Up Conspiracy Groups
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A Trump supporter holding a QAnon flag" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTU4L2FfdHJ1bXBfc3VwcG9ydGVyX2hvbGRpbmdfYV9xYW5vbl9mbGFnLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Scott Olson/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Facebook <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/qanon-groups-hit-facebook-crack-down-n1237330?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">brought</a> the dislike button down on people using its platform to advance harmful beliefs and inaccurate information. The social media giant... </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Booted 1,950 groups, 440 pages, and over 10,000 Instagram accounts tied to QAnon, the movement associated with the conspiracy theory that a worldwide network of devil-worshipping pedophiles are trying to take down President Trump, among other outlandish and inaccurate theories.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Facebook also said it would remove 980 other groups related to potentially violent militias and protest movements, including the far-left group antifa. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>The social isolation and economic strain caused by the pandemic have boosted QAnon’s following. Activity on the largest QAnon Facebook groups grew between 200% and 300% in the last six months, according to a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/19/technology/facebook-qanon-groups-takedown.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT analysis</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At a <a href="https://www.axios.com/trump-praises-qanon-supporters-i-understand-they-like-me-very-much-42146fb3-bd69-4943-8e80-2f0bcf4b0b17.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">press conference</a> yesterday, President Trump said he didn't know a lot about QAnon except that its supporters "like me very much." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>QAnon’s explosive recent growth was clearly a bridge too far for Facebook to ignore. But by policing dangerous beliefs, it’s proving that it’s willing to...police beliefs, a break from past positions.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/19/analysts-support-electric-vehicle-spinoff-gm?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Is a Spinoff and Should GM Do It?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">GM’s stock got a nice little bump this week after analysts tossed around the idea that the American carmaker could <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/gm-shares-soar-electric-car-214649622.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spin off</a> its fledgling electric vehicle division. But what exactly is a spinoff and why might GM be interested?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/ask/answers/032415/how-do-spinoffs-impact-investors-both-parent-and-subsidiary-companies.asp#:~:text=A%20spinoff%20is%20when%20a,shareholders%20of%20the%20parent%20company.&text=It%20is%20common%20for%20the,to%20take%20an%20immediate%20dip.?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spinoff</a> is when a company breaks off a portion of its operations and turns it into a separate entity with its own management and ownership structure. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Spinoffs can be helpful because 1) it lets each business focus on what they're best at and 2) in theory, it gives the spun-off asset more room to grow. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Morning Brew, for example, could spin off our swag business if it distracted us from writing newsletters and we thought it could eventually go toe-to-toe with Lululemon.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Morgan Stanley estimates GM’s electric vehicle business, which hopes to have 20 fully electric models by 2023, to be <a href="https://www.axios.com/gm-electric-vehicle-business-value-0659ba48-40c4-4309-a997-68a32b79c4d8.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worth $20 billion</a> as a standalone unit. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Call it the Tesla effect: </strong>When an all-electric car company is worth 8x as much as you, you take a hint. By spinning off its EV unit, GM might better compete with its suddenly much larger sibling.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/19/microsofts-latest-flight-simulator-leaves-reviewers-emotional?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Videogame...or a Religion?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Flight Simulator screenshot" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTQ5L2ZsaWdodF9zaW11bGF0b3Jfc2NyZWVuc2hvdC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Microsoft</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re the type of person who starts drooling every time you hear the word “fuselage,” Microsoft just left your roommate a puddle to mop off the floor. On Tuesday, the company <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/08/19/microsoft-releases-new-flight-simulator?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> the latest edition of <em>Flight Simulator</em>, its videogame that allows players to take control of a virtual airplane cockpit and fly anywhere on Earth. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Microsoft’s digital rendering of our planet is incredibly realistic, turning even the most cynical tech writers into philosophers:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“The game plunged me into sustained meditations on the permeability between the real world and the online one.”—</span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/19/opinion/microsoft-flight-simulator.html?referringSource=articleShare&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT op-ed</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“</span><span><em>Flight</em></span><span> may provide the most vivid, consumer-friendly demonstration in years of how the bleeding edge of modern technology can provide fundamentally new human experiences.”—</span><span><a href="https://www.protocol.com/microsoft-flight-simulator-2020?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Protocol</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“The visual fidelity is expletive-worthy.”—</span><span><a href="https://theaircurrent.com/technology/exploring-the-big-sky-microsoft-is-creating-for-flight-simulator-2020/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Air Current</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Released in 1982, <em>Flight Simulator </em>is older than Microsoft products Windows, Word, and Office. But perhaps none have <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=1&v=NZLC5ekNJUY&feature=emb_title&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">aged</a> so gracefully.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WHAT ELSE IS BREWING
</h3>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/19/target-tgt-q2-2020-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Target</a></span><span> continued the big box momentum, posting its largest-ever quarterly increase in sales yesterday. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/nvidias-server-business-eclipses-gaming-chips-for-first-time-as-earnings-forecast-blow-away-expectations-2020-08-19?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Nvidia's</a></span><span> data-center business did more in sales last quarter than its core gaming unit for the first time ever.</span>
</li>

The company said the slide in question was not “created or distributed by Goodyear corporate.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/2ba35a44fe1a2cae3c9f3163e92a24f5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Wildfires</a></span><span> continued to rage across California, blanketing San Francisco in smoke.</span>
</li>

Barack Obama, Hillary Clinton, and VP pick Kamala Harris all made the case for Joe Biden while bashing President Trump.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYesterday, the Fed \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/19/fed-minutes.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the most closely read minutes of any meeting in the world. The central bank left it pretty vague per usual, confirming that the coronavirus pandemic will “weigh heavily” on the economy in the short term, and posed “considerable risks” in the medium term.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple’s market cap \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/19/apple-reaches-2-trillion-market-cap.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurpassed $2 trillion\u003c/a\u003e for the first time yesterday, cementing its status as the biggest company in the world. Its stock, which will undergo a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/30/apple-stock-split-announced.html#:~:text=Apple%20announces%204%2Dfor%2D1%20stock%20split\u0026text=Closing%20Bell-,Apple%20on%20Thursday%20announced%20in%20its%20fiscal%20third%2Dquarter%20earnings,ll%20receive%20three%20additional%20shares.?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e4-1 split\u003c/a\u003e in the coming weeks, has increased over 50% in 2020. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple wasn’t the first to break the $2 trillion valuation mark—that honor goes to the oil conglomerate Saudi Aramco—and it (probably) won’t be the last. Big Tech buddies Amazon and Microsoft are both sitting at valuations \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/19/tech/apple-stock-two-trillion-market-value/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earound $1.6 trillion\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA crazy stat: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eit took Apple 42 years to reach a $1 trillion valuation, but only two years after that to break $2 trillion.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow’d Apple do it?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePretty much by just being Apple. The iPhone maker hasn’t released an entirely new product since the HomePod in 2018, mostly focusing on tweaking or updating existing lines. But if there is one thing Apple does well, it’s make money: Despite the pandemic, Apple’s Q3 profits rose 12% while sales of \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/19/technology/apple-2-trillion.html?partner=IFTTT\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eevery single product\u003c/a\u003e increased. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut it doesn’t just sell iPhones: \u003c/strong\u003ePart of investors’ Apple fever has been fueled by CEO Tim Cook’s increased focus on its services business that includes Apple Music, Apple TV+, iCloud, and the App Store. In 2017, Cook outlined his goal to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/19/apples-2-trillion-value-proof-that-tim-cooks-services-plan-worked.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edouble 2016 services revenue\u003c/a\u003e by 2020, which he achieved six months ahead of schedule. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt was a prescient move. With iPhone sales plateauing worldwide, Cook’s pivot has investors valuing Apple less like a hardware company and more like a software one.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThere will always be controversy\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter Cook testified in the \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/21/monopoly-aint-just-board-game-brew-explains-antitrust?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eantitrust showdown\u003c/a\u003e with Congress last month, \u003cem\u003eFortnite \u003c/em\u003ecreator Epic Games poked the bear by attempting to circumvent Apple’s 30% cut of in-app purchases. But even as other developers have \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/14/apps-including-facebook-rally-apple?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejoined in\u003c/a\u003e to criticize Apple’s alleged monopolistic control of the app marketplace, investors remain unfazed. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eApple optimism continues to abound. The iPhone 12 coming this fall is widely expected to come equipped with \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/guides/5g-in-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e5G connectivity\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe CEOs of America's largest companies got a major pay bump (14% on average) from 2018–2019, according to a \u003ca href=\"https://files.epi.org/pdf/204513.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew study\u003c/a\u003e from the Economic Policy Institute, a left-leaning think tank. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhy? The study’s authors say the increase in realized compensation stems from 1) the power CEOs have to set their own pay and 2) stock-based compensation accounting for a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/19/study-average-ceo-pay-increased-in-2019-to-21point3-million-dollars.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emajor slice\u003c/a\u003e of CEO income. That means execs make more $$$ when their company's stock price jumps, rather than hitting other benchmarks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe authors expect CEO pay to leap again in 2020 for that reason—they're paid in stock, and the S\u0026P just reached an all-time high. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003e“Exorbitant CEO pay is a major contributor to rising inequality that we could safely do away with,” the authors argue. To take the long view, CEO pay increased 1,167% from 1978 to 2019, but the typical worker's pay grew a measly 13.7% over the same time span, according to the study's calculations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it hits different in the COVID era: \u003c/strong\u003eSome economists are forecasting a “K-shaped” recovery, where those at the top get richer and those at the bottom fall even further behind.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Facebook \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/qanon-groups-hit-facebook-crack-down-n1237330?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebrought\u003c/a\u003e the dislike button down on people using its platform to advance harmful beliefs and inaccurate information. The social media giant... \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBooted 1,950 groups, 440 pages, and over 10,000 Instagram accounts tied to QAnon, the movement associated with the conspiracy theory that a worldwide network of devil-worshipping pedophiles are trying to take down President Trump, among other outlandish and inaccurate theories.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFacebook also said it would remove 980 other groups related to potentially violent militias and protest movements, including the far-left group antifa. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eThe social isolation and economic strain caused by the pandemic have boosted QAnon’s following. Activity on the largest QAnon Facebook groups grew between 200% and 300% in the last six months, according to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/19/technology/facebook-qanon-groups-takedown.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNYT analysis\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt a \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/trump-praises-qanon-supporters-i-understand-they-like-me-very-much-42146fb3-bd69-4943-8e80-2f0bcf4b0b17.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epress conference\u003c/a\u003e yesterday, President Trump said he didn't know a lot about QAnon except that its supporters \"like me very much.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eQAnon’s explosive recent growth was clearly a bridge too far for Facebook to ignore. But by policing dangerous beliefs, it’s proving that it’s willing to...police beliefs, a break from past positions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" It?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGM’s stock got a nice little bump this week after analysts tossed around the idea that the American carmaker could \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/gm-shares-soar-electric-car-214649622.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espin off\u003c/a\u003e its fledgling electric vehicle division. But what exactly is a spinoff and why might GM be interested?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA \u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/ask/answers/032415/how-do-spinoffs-impact-investors-both-parent-and-subsidiary-companies.asp#:~:text=A%20spinoff%20is%20when%20a,shareholders%20of%20the%20parent%20company.\u0026text=It%20is%20common%20for%20the,to%20take%20an%20immediate%20dip.?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espinoff\u003c/a\u003e is when a company breaks off a portion of its operations and turns it into a separate entity with its own management and ownership structure. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSpinoffs can be helpful because 1) it lets each business focus on what they're best at and 2) in theory, it gives the spun-off asset more room to grow. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMorning Brew, for example, could spin off our swag business if it distracted us from writing newsletters and we thought it could eventually go toe-to-toe with Lululemon.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMorgan Stanley estimates GM’s electric vehicle business, which hopes to have 20 fully electric models by 2023, to be \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/gm-electric-vehicle-business-value-0659ba48-40c4-4309-a997-68a32b79c4d8.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworth $20 billion\u003c/a\u003e as a standalone unit. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCall it the Tesla effect: \u003c/strong\u003eWhen an all-electric car company is worth 8x as much as you, you take a hint.
